articles.author: Valerie Hopkins
articles.title: Amid Crisis, Kazakhstan’s Leader Chose His Path: Embrace Russia - The New York Times
articles.description: With his government under siege, Kassym-Jomart Tokayev, Kazakhstan’s president, turned to Russia’s Vladimir V. Putin for support. The choice could realign Central Asia’s politics.
articles.content:
And for 28 years, he was effectively Mr. Nazarbayevs understudy.
Since taking office, Mr. Tokayev has not had to contend with real political competition. Under his leadership, there has been a signi… [+2631 chars]

articles.title: Li Jinglei hit by backlash in Wang Leehom saga; good friend Patty Hou becomes unexpected target - AsiaOne
articles.description: If you thought 2021 marked the end of the Wang Leehom-Li Jinglei divorce saga, think again. Only this time, the tide appears to have turned — in Leehom's favour. According to Taiwan media reports, the "whitewashing" of the Mandopop singer's misdeeds in recent…
articles.content:
If you thought 2021 marked the end of the Wang Leehom-Li Jinglei divorce saga, think again. Only this time, the tide appears to have turned  in Leehom's favour.

articles.title: Kazakh president orders forces to open fire without warning - SBS News
articles.description: Kazakh President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev's comments come after days of uprising in the Central Asian former Soviet republic.
articles.content:
Mr Tokayev also thanked Russian President Vladimir Putin as well as the leaders of China, Uzbekistan and Turkey for their assistance in quelling the uprising.
